div.pre: 1898 Cotrone, 5 km. N of Croton, Brut- (277, 506) tium, 1927 Burial: c. 430 B.C. (K) Contents: 130+ AR. Pot hoard, dispersed and partly recovered Taras: 20 st. (to horsemen, Per. I) Laus: 1 st. (double-relief) Metapontum: 12 st. (to Noe 310) Poseidonia: 4 st. (double-relief) Sybaris: 1 st. Thurium: 4 st.; 2 fr. Velia: 1 st.; 2 fr. Caulonia: 22 st.; 1 fr. Croton: 41 st.; 3 fr. Terina: 7 st. Probably intrusive: Croton: 11 fr. (see no. 1939 below) Leontini: 2 tetradr. Syracuse: 1 tetradr.; 1 AE (Hieron II) Disposition: Reggio 133 (as listed by Cata- nuto); Vlasto 2 (Cat. 69, 245, from Noe 506); Ginori, coins of Thurium (SNG- Oxford 883 and 887, both formerly Ginori, may be from N. 506) † Catanuto, NSc 1932, pp. 387-92 (= N. 277 including intrusive items) † Kraay, SNR 1970, pp. 69-71 (for details of N. 506, and for the common source of N. 277 and 506) See also no. 1939 below
